description.narrative: By 2016 international standards, best practices and a national framework on the right to participate are available to key partners, for supporting and strengthening the adolescent development and citizenship, with special attention to girls, indigenous and afrodescent groups., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Protection Systems, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Education â€“ General, Human Rights Institutions, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, adolescent boys and girls from indigenous and afro-Brazilian origin, and those living in the semiarid, the amazon region and the poorest areas of urban centres are specifically targeted by a multisectoral public policy aimed at reducing existing inequalities in terms of rights realization for adolescents, and supported by a legal framework for the right to participation, with a positive perception by society on their capacity to contribute to social changes.

participating-org.narrative: FUNDACAO PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO CIENTIFICO E TECNOLOGICO EM SAUDE

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016 international standards, best practices and a national framework on the right to participate are available to key partners, for supporting and strengthening the adolescent development and citizenship, with special attention to girls, indigenous and afrodescent groups.

description.narrative: Over 1,400 municipalities fora were organized with the participation of adolescents, community leaders and municipal authorities to strength participatory processes at the local level. At the national level adolescents' networks from most vulnerable adolescents' groups with specific needs were consolidated through capacity building. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Platforms Seal with adolescents participating in national networks

actual.value: 2016:58% of the municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Platforms Seal (Semiarid and Amazon) with adolescents participating in national networks.

title.narrative: Percentage of state committees of the Seal initiative in each platform with forums for adolescents' participation.

actual.value: 2016:73% of the state committees of the Seal initiative (Semiarid and Amazon) with forums for adolescents' participation.

title.narrative: Number of girls and boys adolescents trained in life skills through youth communication centers established by UNICEF local partners in the semiarid, the amazon and Urban Centers

baseline.value: 0 - The life skills curriculum was developed was developed in 2011

actual.value: 2016:TARGET ACHIEVED In 2016, 635 adolescent boys and girls from large urban centers were trained in life skills. They attended workshops with focus on core abilities, knowledge and attitudes that can be learned during adolescence such as rights' promotion and protection, civic participation and social c

title.narrative: % of adolescents aged 16-17 enrolled in the electoral process and able to vote

actual.value: 2016:40%. In order to improve this indicator UNICEF established a partnership with the Superior Electoral Court in late 2016 to conduct a political education project in early 2017 to address this issue and encourage adolescents' participation in the electoral process.

title.narrative: Number of adolescents' networks strengthened by UNICEF

baseline.value: 7 (Redes de adolescentes do semirido, da Amaznia, rede nacional de adolescentes comunicadores, rede de adolescentes vivendo com HIV, rede de adolescentes pelo direito ao esporte seguro e inclusivo,

target.value: 2016:10 (including by creating one national network of Afrodescendants, one on girl's empowerment and one on adolescents in rural areas for the right to upper secondary education)

actual.value: 2016:TARGET ACHIEVED: UNICEF supported 13 adolescent-led networks were created in previous years. In 2016, the adolescent-led networks that received special attention to be renovated and strengthened were the following: LGBT Adolescent Network: The first LGBT Adolescent Network meeting was held in São P

title.narrative: National System of Social Participation approved by the Parliament

baseline.value: National System of Social Participation has been proposed by the Brazilian Federal Government to the Parliament

actual.value: 2016:In October 2014, the President's decree proposing the regulation of popular councils and the establishment of the National System of Social Participation was revoked by the National Congress. The proposal was supposed to be reviewed in 2015, however due to changes in the policy priorities of the Nat

title.narrative: Existence of a National Framework for the Right to Participate

baseline.value: No framework. Articles of Statute of the Child and Adolescents (1989) and the National Education Law(1996) are used as reference.

target.value: 2013:National Framework for the Right to Participate developed with UNICEF's support

actual.value: 2016:TARGET ACHIEVED Yes, as previously reported (available at UNICEF and at the National Youth Secretariat websites).
